Our nation is facing a crisis of domestic and dating violence, sexual assault, and stalking. By reauthorizing VAWA we will better equip our state and local partners with the resources needed to help rebuild and heal the lives of those who have been impacted.

#VAWA is landmark legislation that responds to our nation’s crisis of domestic violence. It funds programs that provide compassionate care and support for women, families, and – yes – men too.

The Senate urgently needs to vote on this.

We need VAWA now.

Drinking water is at risk because the EPA has failed to regulate usage and disposal of PFAS chemicals. We must ensure communities across the country have the resources needed to remove and dispose of these toxins. 

EPA should have done this long ago, but now Congress must act.

A major source of PFAS contamination stems from firefighting foams used at military bases, commercial airports, and other federal facilities. We need to clean up these facilities and find safer firefighting alternatives. https://upnorthlive.com/news/local/study-michigan-has-most-pfas-contaminated-sites-in-united-states …

PFAS chemicals have been linked to cancer, heart disease, and liver disease. 
 
We need to rid these chemicals wherever they exist. https://www.techtimes.com/articles/242103/20190424/scientists-are-revisiting-pfas-and-the-dangers-they-pose-to-human-health.htm …
